message:
I'm in the preliminary stages of building an invitation website in 
which users can choose their invitations and then choose from a 
variety of customizations.  I'm thinking that node.js (and/or 
backbone) would be a good fit. 
I'm basically looking for very fast updates to the "preview" of the 
invite and additionally the ability to have a decent number of users 
using the invite builder concurrently. 
Any input on this would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks a lot for the info!

I would do it in ruby together with pusher.com and hosted mongodb in the backend. Node.js is great but probably overkill (if you do node look into socket.io). backbone.js for the javascript side is a great choice. Don't forget to use coffeescript instead of javascript
you just said use ruby. pusher and hosted mongodb. and then say node is overkill. that sounded more like a sales pitch than advice to be honest.
I agree with @context. Nodejs combined with express and backbone would probably work fine
